meanings.sent1: She decided to galavant through the park, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his chores, he liked to galavant around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to galavant around the house, exploring every nook and cranny.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would galavant from one idea to another, never settling on one.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly would galavant from flower to flower, spreading joy wherever it went.

meanings.definition: To go around in search of pleasure or amusement
meanings.sent1: On weekends, they would galavant to different restaurants to try new foods.
meanings.sent2: During the summer, families often galavant to the beach for a day of fun.
meanings.sent3: The children would galavant around the playground, laughing and playing games.
meanings.sent4: In her dreams, she would galavant through magical lands, meeting fantastical creatures.
meanings.sent5: The explorer would galavant across continents, seeking adventure and new experiences.
